Jon Saad-Falcon

I currently work as a research assistant at Stanford University , advised by Christopher Potts and Matei Zaharia. I completed the joint B.S./M.S. in Computer Science in the College of Computing at Georgia Tech , where I was advised byPolo Chau and Diyi Yang, working at the Polo Club of Data Science and Social and Language Technologies (SALT) lab, respectively. I was supported by the Stamps President's Scholarship. Additionally, I worked as a Predoctoral Young Investigator at the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2), advised by Doug Downey.
My research interests span across natural language processing, machine learning, information extraction, and information retrieval. I'm excited to work on projects that combine NLP architectures and models with IR systems.
I've had the privilege to collaborate with researchers and scientists at Stanford AI Lab, Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2), and Goldman Sachs.
